column4: if i upgrade to hardy through Update Manager will i be able to downgrade afterwards if needed

Not that I know of, but I have not searched the forums on it, I was on Intrepid and reverted back to Hardy, tip: download and burn the ISO for Hardy now, also make backups, if all works well, then you have some christmas tree ornaments
After the intrepid upgrade, I used the ISO's that I made on Hardy and just reinstalled, sorta.
you effectively wiped Intrepid and installed Hardy?
Yes, the Hardy reformatted over the Intrepid and it worked, I am now on Hardy 8.01.2
i was trying to avoid a reinstall
i have /home on its own partition if that's what you mena
No, I mean a Home backup, on CD-R or DVD-r, I like to play it with all options covered.

just had a thought... the reason i'm wary about upgrading to Intrepid is because i installed it only to find it doesnt support my network card. Would it work to install Intrepid in a VM and troubleshoot it there, and then apply the fix(es) to a real install afterwards??
That sounds very logical, and perhaps you could workaround the error, it must be solve able becuase it is an upgrade, or it could be broken for the same reasons.
i installed Hardy with the intention of trying an upgrade to Intrepid
but ive invested too much time into this install to bork it now
i take it you mean Update Manager?
